name: Pennsylvania
title: OPINION: Pennsylvania students deserve better than a delayed state budget
description: In Pennsylvania, districts burdened by adequacy funding gaps, poverty isn't an abstract concept—it’s the daily reality for 70% of enrolled students. In July 2024, the Pennsylvania General Assembly delivered a landmark, bipartisan solution by codifying a new methodology for calculating the state's obligation to underfunded districts and integrating it into the 2024-25 state budget. In my home district, that alarming figure swelled to 77%.

name: Education Funding
title: Province signs agreement with federal government for school food program funding
description: A new phase for the National School Food Program is set to take place in Saskatchewan as the federal and provincial governments look for ways to develop new school food programs. Earlier this year, the federal and provincial governments signed a $15.8 million three-year agreement under the National School Food Program. $6.4 million of federal funding is earmarked for school divisions in the 2025-26 school year to support programs for urban, rural, or northern schools.
